23.m: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control; against such things there is no law. - Galatians 5:22 (ESV)

l.q: What was Paul urging the saints in Galatia to do?
l.a: Paul is urging the saints to walk by the Spirit and not gratify the desires of the flesh.

l.q: What are the works of the flesh?
l.a: The works of the flesh are: sexual immorality, impurity, sensuality, idolatry, sorcery, enmity, strife, jealousy, fits of anger, rivalries, dissensions, divisions, envy, drunkenness, orgies, and similar things.

l.q: What are the fruits of the Spirit?
l.a: The fruits of the Spirit are love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control.

23.p: Father God, thank you for how you continue to work in my heart so I can be a channel of your blessing to others. It is easier to love those who also love me, but there is no more place in my heart for insecurities, for I am your child and I already have everything in you. May other be blessed with the good fruits that they see in me, for your glory.
